title: CadOrchestrator Config Options Schema
description: This schema defines all the possible configurations of a hardware project. This is used to generate the UI of the CadOrchestrator server and to format the JSON response that goes to the project's configuration function.

options.description: This is a list of the configuration options

list-option.description: Allows the user to add a list of items. You can have multiple types of items to add. These are set with add-options

option-type.description: Set this to "list", to specify this is a list-option

label.description: Optional. Add a label at the top of the whole list.

item-name.description: Optional. Each item will be labelled in the list as "Item 1", "Item 2". Use this to override the word "Item".

response-key.description: Required. This is the key in the generated configuration JSON returned to your configuration function

add-options.description: Required. This is a list of the add buttons for the list and the options they set.

option-type.description: Set this to "numeric", to specify this is a numeric-option

label.description: Required. Add a label for this option in the WebApp.

response-key.description: Required. This is the key in the generated configuration JSON returned to your configuration function

option-type.description: Set this to "text", to specify this is a text-option

label.description: Required. Add a label for this option in the WebApp.

response-key.description: Required. This is the key in the generated configuration JSON returned to your configuration function

option-type.description: Set this to "boolean", to specify this is a boolean-option

label.description: Required. Add a label for this option in the WebApp.

response-key.description: Required. This is the key in the generated configuration JSON returned to your configuration function

add-option.description: This sets a dropdown to add items to a list. Lists can have multiple add-options.

display-name.description: The name of the of this category to be used in the WebApp.

id.description: A javascript friendly version of the above display name

items.description: All possible values. This creates list of options in the dropdown menu.

value.description: The value in the returned JSON if this is chosen

name.description: The name that shows up in the WebApp.
